com.facebook.stats

Class AbstractCompositeCounter<C extends EventCounterIf<C>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.stats.AbstractCompositeCounter<C>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CompositeEventCounterIf<C>, EventCounterIf<C>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractCompositeSum, CompositeMax, CompositeMin

    public abstract class AbstractCompositeCounter<C extends EventCounterIf<C>>
extends Object
implements CompositeEventCounterIf<C>
    Tracks stats over a rolling time period (time window) of maxLength broken into parts (eventCounters list) of size maxChunkLength. Meant to be subclassed. Primary use is through repeatedly calling add() and occasionally calling getValue().

    1. Does trimming of event buckets (based on the window size) 2. Allows for updates of this window's events based on updates to component windows (useful for overlapping window stats)

    Optimized for write-heavy counters.

        public abstract C merge(C counter)
        Create a new counter that is the result of merging this counter and the argument. No deep copy is performed, so the resulting copy could in theory be a counter that just lists this and counter in a list

      • add

        public CompositeEventCounterIf<C> add(long delta,
                             org.joda.time.ReadableDateTime start,
                             org.joda.time.ReadableDateTime end)
        Description copied from interface: CompositeEventCounterIf
        creates a new counter and adds it to the composite one. Despite being a public method, this is most often used inside of other counters to add a new "head" counter when computing multiple window lengths. The counter object is shared by all windows and eventually merged when its duration has completed
        Specified by:
        add in interface CompositeEventCounterIf<C extends EventCounterIf<C>>
        Parameters:
        delta - value of the new counter
        Returns:
        the CompositeEventCounterIf after adding the new counter

      • addEventCounter

        public CompositeEventCounterIf<C> addEventCounter(C eventCounter)
        Description copied from interface: CompositeEventCounterIf
        Add an already created counter to the ComopsiteEvenCountIf. This is similar to CompositeEventCounterIf.add(long, org.joda.time.ReadableDateTime, org.joda.time.ReadableDateTime) but externalizes creation of the counter to add. ie, you can add another CompositeEventCounterIf if C so allows it, allowing for nesting of composition to arbitrary depths.
        Specified by:
        addEventCounter in interface CompositeEventCounterIf<C extends EventCounterIf<C>>
        Parameters:
        eventCounter - counter to add
        Returns:
        this after adding eventCounter

      • internalMerge

        protected <C2 extends CompositeEventCounterIf<C>> C2 internalMerge(Collection<? extends C> otherCounters,
                                                       C2 mergedCounter)
        This merges another sorted list of counters with our own and produces a new counter.

        our own counters are protected from mutation via synchronization. The behavior of this function is not defined if otherCounters changes while a merge is taking place;

        Type Parameters:
        C2 -
        Parameters:
        otherCounters - usually some other object's counters, or a single counter that's being added via addEventCounter()
        mergedCounter -
        Returns:

      • trimIfNeeded

        protected void trimIfNeeded()
        Updates the current composite counter so that it is up to date with the current timestamp.

        This should be called by any method that needs to have the most updated view of the current set of counters.

      • getExpiredFraction

        protected float getExpiredFraction(EventCounterIf<C> oldestCounter)
        Takes the oldest counter and returns the fraction [0, 1] of it that has extended outside the current time window of the composite counter.

        Assumes: counter.getEnd() >= window.getStart() counter.getStart() < window.getStart()

        Parameters:
        oldestCounter -
        Returns:
        fraction [0, 1]

      • getEventCounters

        protected Collection<C> getEventCounters()
        Get a the current set of event counters. The counters will be sorted in ascending order according to time, meaning the earliest counter will appear first in any iteration
        Returns:
        unmodifiable Collection of event counters
